counter_intuitive.title: Production Code Cloning for Learning
counter_intuitive.perspective: What if studying production code actually constrains original thinking and architectural creativity?
counter_intuitive.reasoning: The heavy focus on reverse-engineering Adobe's production systems might be creating mental models that limit exploration of alternative approaches. Original architectural thinking could be more valuable than perfect reconstruction.

expertChallenge.content: Then at the end, they can let it run for a few minutes. They can think through something else that's interesting or they anticipate is going to be hairy, and they come back to something that's probably a little better than vibe coded. Because they were so systematic about it upfront, they're much closer to something that looks like production code.
expertChallenge.episodeTitle: How to measure AI developer productivity in 2025 | Nicole Forsgren

counter_intuitive.title: Multiple Prototype Strategy
counter_intuitive.perspective: What if maintaining fewer, deeper prototypes would accelerate learning more than building many shallow ones?
counter_intuitive.reasoning: The pattern shows many concurrent projects (Catalog, Inspiration, Commerce Simulator, various clones). Deep expertise from sustained focus on 1-2 core systems might yield better PM insights than broad surface-level prototyping.

expertChallenge.speaker: Tamar Yehoshua
expertChallenge.content: If you're doing it right, it'll be faster and you need to have an engineering infrastructure that enables prototyping. So some engineering infrastructures are too heavy and they don't actually enable prototyping. We had a problem with our mobile apps that it was too hard to prototype and we actually redesigned our mobile apps until we got to the point where it was easier because our desktop app wa...
expertChallenge.episodeTitle: Lessons in product leadership and AI strategy from Glean, Google, Amazon, and Slack | Tamar Yehoshua

unexplored_territory.title: User Research and Validation
unexplored_territory.why: Given the focus on building prototypes for enterprise workflows and AI tools, there's notably little discussion of user testing, feedback loops, or validation with actual end users. This could lead to technically sound but user-misaligned products.

expertInsight.content: We always hear, "Okay, you have a mock, you have a prototype. Yeah, testing with users always feels like this heavy thing. You got to have a user research team, go do interviews, do one-on-ones." What you're describing is something... I don't know why everyone's not doing this. With AI tools, it's so easy now. Have an idea, build the prototype, test it with, I don't know, is it like dozens of peop...
expertInsight.episodeTitle: “Dumbest idea I’ve heard” to $100M ARR: Inside the rise of Gamma | Grant Lee (co-founder)

unexplored_territory.title: Performance and Scalability Testing
unexplored_territory.why: With complex systems like Inspiration handling large chat histories and enterprise prototypes modeling high-volume operations, the absence of performance profiling, load testing, or scalability discussions could create technical debt that undermines prototype credibility.
